quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Country and Countries
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, people, kangaroo. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which two countries border the Dead Sea?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jordan and Israel

questions.question: What are the Tropic of Cancer and the Tropic of Capricorn?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lines of latitude

questions.question: What major geographical feature is located at 23.5 degrees North latitude?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Tropic of Cancer

questions.question: Which would be found at 39 degrees 43 minutes North latitude?

options.text: The majority of the Mason-Dixon Line.
The border between Canada and  Washington State.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The majority of the Mason-Dixon Line.

questions.question: Did the 13 colonies declare their independence in 1776?
Where would you find the shortest river in the world?
Which statement about the emu and the kangaroo is not true?

options.text: Both are indigenous only to Australia.
Both are on the national emblem of Australia.
Both are incapable of  walking backwards.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Both are indigenous only to Australia.

questions.question: What was the former name of the city of Istanbul ?
What are the three Benelux countries?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Belgium, Netherlands and Luxembourg

questions.question: How many US states border the Gulf of Mexico?
Measuring at the Equator, what is the closest approximation of the Earths circumference?
Which country held the record for the highest birth rate in the 2005 world statistics?
Europe is the smallest continent.
The people of which country watched the most TV per week in 2005?
Is it true that Yasseir Arafat became chairman of the Palestinian Liberation Organization in 2004?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Lake and World
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, lakes, peak. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This is the lowest lake on Earth, situated at about 400 meters below sea level on the border between Israel and Jordan.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dead Sea

questions.question: What Canadian lake is the largest in the world, located on an island?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nettilling Lake

questions.question: This country, situated in North Europe, has almost 200 000 lakes - more than any other country in the world.
The highest mountain peak on our planet is Mount Everest. It was first climbed by Edmund Hillary and Tenzing Norgay on May 29, 1953. What is the home country of Sir Edmund Hillary?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New Zealand

questions.question: How many US states border the Pacific Ocean?
The tallest mountain peak in the US is Mount McKinley. This is the second tallest.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mount Saint Elias

questions.question: This freshwater-lake island, with a surface area of 2,766 km², is the biggest on Earth.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Manitoulin Island

questions.question: Which saltwater lake, bordered on the west by Azerbaijan and Russia, is the largest inland body of water in the world?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Caspian Sea

questions.question: Which tiny lake located in Tibet is the highest lake on Earth?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lhagba Pool

questions.question: This water body, which is South Americas largest freshwater lake, is the highest commercially navigable lake.
This country has more than 60% of worlds lakes due to its special drainage system.
Which one of these mountains is not a volcano?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mount Aspiring

questions.question: With a surface area of about 82,000 km², this lake between Ontario and Minnesota is the largest single freshwater lake in the world.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lake Superior

questions.question: Which body of water, situated in Southern Siberia, is the deepest and oldest freshwater lake on Earth?
Which one of these ski resorts is not located in the Alps?

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Motto and Official Motto
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, people, carolina. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The official motto of this state in the Pacific Northwest of the United States comes from Chinook Jargon.
Which of these states has an official motto that doesnt include the word rights in it?
Phreatic eruptions occur when the temperature of magma is relatively low and it solidifies very quickly, sometimes blocking the vent of the volcano.
Which volcano, located on Ross Island, Antarctica, is the southernmost active volcano on Earth?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mount Erebus

questions.question: The word volcano comes from the name of the Roman god of fire, Vulcan. Who is the analogue of Vulcan in Greek mythology?
Which of the following states has an official motto In God we trust, which is also the official motto of the United States of America?
Which of the following maxims, meaning The people rule, is the official state motto of Arkansas?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Regnat populus

questions.question: Which of the following states of America is an inland one and has an official motto that does not come from Latin?

Yellowstone Caldera is considered a supervolcano because within the past two million years it has erupted extremely violently three times . The most recent eruption occurred this long ago, and spread volcanic ash over most of the North American continent.
This famous Latin maxim, which is the official motto of South Carolina, means While I breathe, I hope.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dum spiro spero

questions.question: North to the Future is the official motto of this US state, which is the largest in area.
This famous exclamation, which has been attributed to ancient scientist Archimedes, is the official state motto of California.
Three of these US states have an official motto related to liberty. Spot the odd one.
Three of the following US states have a motto consisting of one single word in English. Which one does not belong to the group?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: West Virginia

questions.question: If magma contains more than 65% silica, the lava is called this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: felsic or acidic

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Volcano and Countries
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, destruction, denmark. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Towards the beginning of the new millennium, three of these four countries had a population of approximately 32 million people. Which is the odd one?
Canada, the United States and China are three countries whose total area is approximately 12 million sq km.
Which is the volcanically active region that is situated in a famous national US park and has a territory of 55 kilometers by 72 kilometers?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yellowstone Caldera

questions.question: This volcano, which is the largest in Europe, is located on the largest island in the Mediterranean Sea.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mount Etna

questions.question: Where is the southernmost point in all 50 states?
This dormant volcano, which is 66 km northeast of Tehran, is the symbol of Iranian resistance against foreign rule.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mount Damavand

questions.question: What is the biggest extinct volcano in Ecuador, situated in the Andes mountain.
This active volcano, whose name means long mountain in Hawaiian, is one of the five peaks that form the Island of Hawaii.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mauna Loa

questions.question: The name of this volcano, located on the Alaska Peninsula, means new eruption.
What volcano located on the island of Tenerife represents the highest mountain on Spanish territories?
The state with the largest area in the lower 48 is?
And where is the lowest point in the USA, North America, and western hemisphere? I need the state and national park name.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: California, Death Valley NP

questions.question: Mount Vesuvius, that is notorious for the destruction of two Roman cities in the year 79, was linked most closely to which hero and demigod?
Popocatépetl, a volcano whose name means Smoking Mountain, is 70 km away from the capital of which American country?
England, Norway, Belgium and Denmark all border this sea.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: North sea

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Island and World
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, country, countrys. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This is the largest island in the Mediterranean Sea, famous for one of the worlds most active volcanoes - Etna.

Because of its spectacular nature forms, one of this insular countrys islands has been a set for the filming of many movie productions, including the highly successful, Lord of the Rings and The Chronicles of Narnia.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New Zealand

questions.question: Al Nakheel Properties, one of the leading real estate developers in Dubai and creator of the worldwide famous Palm Islands, is also the initiator of another grand project of artificial islands, which resembles the shape of what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The globe

questions.question: Being the most populous in the world, with bigger population than Australia and Antarctica, the density of this islands inhabitants forced the countrys government to start transmigration programs, aimed at resettling people to other, less-crowded parts of the country.
The gowni is a typical national costume in which African country?
In the beginning of the new millennium, Russias, Iraqs and Saudi Arabias oil reserves were above 100 billion bbl.
The US is one of the leading countries in the number plastic surgery procedures.
All of these countries and commonwealth territories have a high divorce rate except one.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sri Lanka

questions.question: Which of the following is a traditional Vietnamese clothing, worn primarily by women?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Áo dài

questions.question: Dominica, New Zealand and Finland are three countries with high crime rates.
USA is considered to be one of the most popular destinations, where thousands of immigrants come to seek asylum. Just one of these four states is similar in to USA in this respect.

This island is well known in scientific fields for being home of five percent of the worlds plant and animal species, with 80% of them unique to it. The island is also the fourth biggest on Earth, with population of about 17,500,000 people.
Ireland, Germany and Austria are famous for the high consumption of this alcohol.
Despite being the largest in the world, this island is sparsely populated, due to its unfavourable climate.
In Greek mythology, this island is the legendary birthplace of the goddess of beauty, love, and passion, the charming Aphrodite, where according to the legend, she emerged from the sea foam.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: London and Clothing
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, harrods, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The Old Royal Observatory, which is a part of the National Maritime Museum in London, was built in what year?
Who made the statue of King Richard I outside the Houses of Parliament in Old Palace Yard in London?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Baron Carlo Marochetti

questions.question: These knee-breeches made of leather are a traditional Bavarian garment.
Which of these pieces of clothing is worn on the head?
Barong is the embroidered formal garment of which country in South-East Asia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Philippines

questions.question: Hijab, which is also a term meaning barrier, is worn as a traditional clothing in which countries?
The Jewel Tower, built in 1366, is physically separated from the Palace of Westminster in London.
The famous department store Harrods that occupies an entire block is located on which road in London?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brompton Road

questions.question: Which of these national costumes does not belong to a European nation?
Three of the enlisted national garments are African, while the fourth one is Norwegian. Which one?
According to the legend, which of these is a part of the Three Fortunate Concealments that protect Britain from any danger coming from the sea?

options.text: The head of Bran the Blessed
The bones of Gwerthefyr the Blessed

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The head of Bran the Blessed

questions.question: Which one of the following national costumes is not Chinese?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kente cloth

questions.question: Which of these national costumes is closely related to Sikhism - a religion that comes from 16th-century northern India?
The Great Pavement, a hidden, unknown to most tourists and seldom-displayed treasure, is located in which building in London?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Westminster Abbey

questions.question: While driving or walking down Kings Cross Road and Farringdon Road in London few people are aware that unseen beneath them runs which river?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: River Fleet
